clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Effectiveness of Home-based Programs for Preschool Children With Developmental Delay
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Effectiveness of Home-based Programs for Preschool Children With Developmental Delay:a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Early intervention refers to the provision of early detection, early diagnosis, and early intervention for infants and young children with special needs. The implementation of home programs is very important for children with developmental delay (DD). Therefore, the purposes of this study are to: (1) design the preschool home program activities(PHPA), (2) investigate the immediate efficacy of PHPA for children with DD, (3) investigate the long-term efficacy of PHPA for children with DD.The second year is to investigate the immediate efficacy of PHPA for children with DD.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 36 children with DD, aged 2-6 years, were randomly assigned to the professional-based group (professional therapists delivering the PHPA, total n=13), parents-based group (parents executing the PHPA, n=12) and control group (health education only, n=11). Outcome measures included clinical assessments and subjective questionnaires. The clinical assessments were Comprehensive Developmental Inventory for Infants and Toddlers (CDIIT). The subjective questionnaires were Chinese Child Developmental Inventory (CCDI), Assessment of preschool children's participation (APCP), TN0-AZL Preschool quality of life (TAPQOL) and parent stress index (PSI). Tests were administrated before and after the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in clinical assessment after 8 weeks intervention of PHPA at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: The clinical assessments were Comprehensive Developmental Inventory for Infants and Toddlers (CDIIT).

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in Chinese Child Developmental Inventory (CCDI) after 8 weeks intervention of PHPA at 6 months

intervention.description: PHPA are delivered by professional therapists, which including gross motor, fine motor, cognition verbal, social interactions, activity of daily living(ADL).
PHPA are executed by parents, which including gross motor, fine motor, cognition verbal, social interactions, ADL.
health education of the children with DD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 0 to 6-years-old children
- clinical diagnosis of DD and other related disorders
Exclusion Criteria:
- unstable physiological conditions
- progression or regression symptoms
